content: I'm glad I could recall the event details! Yeah, I think what helped me achieve my personal best time was the perfect weather conditions that day - 75°F and 40% humidity. I also spent weeks practicing my launch control technique beforehand, which definitely paid off. Additionally, I made some adjustments to my car's suspension, which helped me take the turns more smoothly. And, of course, the advice I got from a seasoned drag racer at a track day two weeks prior to the event was super helpful. He gave me some valuable tips on how to fine-tune my car's gearing for better acceleration.
